explanations.machine learning: The paper mentions the use of artificial intelligence (AI) methods, including Support Vector Machine (SVM), Artificial Neural Network (ANN), and Nearest Neighbours Classification (NNC), which are all machine learning techniques.
explanations.supervised learning: The AI methods used (SVM, ANN, NNC) are typically applied in supervised learning contexts where models are trained on labeled data to predict or classify outcomes.
explanations.classification: The paper specifically mentions that AI methods are used to classify flash flood occurrences, indicating the use of classification techniques.
explanations.support vector machine: The paper explicitly mentions the use of Support Vector Machine (SVM) as one of the AI methods for predicting and classifying flash flood occurrences.
explanations.SVM: SVM is an abbreviation for Support Vector Machine, which is directly mentioned in the paper as one of the AI methods used.
explanations.neural network: The paper mentions the use of Artificial Neural Network (ANN), which is a type of neural network, for predicting and classifying flash flood occurrences.
